product_overview: ETUTI is a comprehensive digital platform specializing in fresh fruits and natural products native to Angola, focusing initially on pineapple and its derivatives. The platform connects local producers with consumers to provide fresh, sustainable, and traceable products via e-commerce, subscription plans, and educational content, aiming to enhance health and promote local agriculture.
core_goals: Develop a scalable and secure e-commerce platform for both B2C and B2B sales of fresh fruits and natural products.
Promote transparency and traceability by integrating local producers directly into the supply chain.
Provide educational content about nutritional benefits and healthy recipes to engage users.
Implement subscription-based delivery services for recurring customers.
Deliver a seamless user experience across web and mobile with high performance and accessibility standards.
Establish robust backend services including inventory, orders, payments, and logistics management.
Enable administration with dashboards for product, order, inventory, content, and user management.
key_features: User Authentication and Profile Management with JWT and MFA options.
Product Catalog with filtering, search, detailed nutritional info, and multimedia.
Shopping Cart with persistence, discount coupons, and product suggestions.
Multi-step Checkout integrated with local payment gateways like Multicaixa Express and payment methods including mobile wallet and cash on delivery.
Subscription Plans allowing users to choose recurring fruit deliveries with customization.
Interactive Farmers Directory featuring map with farmer profiles using Leaflet.
Admin Dashboard for sales analytics, inventory control, content management, and user administration with RBAC.
Order tracking system with real-time updates and multi-channel notifications (email, SMS, WhatsApp).
Content Management System supporting blog posts, recipes, banners, and FAQs.
Mobile App providing core functionalities including biometric auth, push notifications, and geolocation.
Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
Comprehensive security and data protection measures including encryption, rate limiting, and GDPR compliance.
user_flow_summary: User Registration and Login: Users can create accounts, recover passwords, and manage profiles including addresses and preferences.

Product Discovery and Purchase: Visitors browse or search the product catalog, view product details, add items to cart, apply coupons, and proceed through a simplified checkout process with delivery address and payment method selection.
Subscription Setup: Users select subscription plans, customize fruit preferences, set delivery frequency, and manage their subscription dashboard including pause, modify, or cancel options.
Order Management: After placing orders, users receive confirmation emails, track delivery status via the platform or notifications, and view past orders in their profile.
Admin Operations: Administrators log in to a dashboard to manage products, inventory, orders, users, and content, generate reports, and monitor system performance.
Mobile Experience: Mobile users interact through an optimized app with biometric login, streamlined product browsing, and real-time order updates.
Educational Content Engagement: Users access blog posts and interactive guides about fruit benefits and recipes, with direct calls to action leading to product pages.
validation_criteria: All core API endpoints must be fully documented and tested with at least 70% code coverage before release.
Frontend performance targets: Largest Contentful Paint under 2.5s and First Contentful Paint under 1.5s on desktop and mobile devices.
Successful integration with Multicaixa Express payment gateway and other supported local payment methods, confirmed by end-to-end transaction tests.
Accessibility compliance verified by automated tools (axe, Lighthouse) and manual audits to achieve WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
Beta user testing must achieve NPS of 50 or higher and gather feedback addressing at least 90% of critical usability issues before go-live.
Security audits including penetration testing to confirm mitigation of OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and data protection compliance with GDPR and LGPD.
Administration workflows must allow content publishing, inventory alerts, user management, and report generation without critical defects.
Subscription management features must support all planned user actions (creation, modification, pause, cancel) with proper billing and notification handling.
Error rates and downtime monitored post-launch must remain below defined thresholds (error rate <1%, downtime <0.1%).
